channel.title: Book Summaries by Dean Stewart on Shortened Books
channel.description: Recent content in Book Summaries by Dean Stewart on Shortened Books

item.title: Crushing It! by Gary Vaynerchuk (Summary & Review)
item.description: “Crushing It!: How Great Entrepreneurs Build Their Business and Influence-and How You Can, Too” is a bestselling self-help book written by entrepreneur and social media expert Gary Vaynerchuk.

item.title: Peak by Anders Ericsson and Robert Pool (Summary & Review)
item.description: “Peak: Secrets from the New Science of Expertise” is a book written by Anders Ericsson and Robert Pool, published in 2016.

item.title: The Dhammapada by Eknath Easwaran (Summary & Review)
item.description: “The Dhammapada” is a collection of sayings of the Buddha in verse form.

item.title: Principles: Life and Work by Ray Dalio (Summary & Review)
item.description: “Principles: Life and Work” is a book written by Ray Dalio, who is the founder of the investment firm Bridgewater Associates.

item.title: Happy Together by Suzann Pawelski (Summary & Review)
item.description: “Happy Together: Using the Science of Positive Psychology to Build Love That Lasts” by Suzann Pileggi Pawelski and James O.

item.title: Stillness Is the Key by Ryan Holiday (Summary & Review)
item.description: “Stillness Is the Key” is a self-help book written by Ryan Holiday that explores the power of stillness and mindfulness in modern life.

item.title: Flourish by Martin Seligman (Summary & Review)
item.description: “Flourish: A Visionary New Understanding of Happiness and Well-being” is a book written by Martin Seligman, a psychologist and researcher who is known for his work on the topic of positive psychology.
